citation.article-title: Thalassospira xianhensis sp. nov., a polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon-degrading marine bacterium
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Thalassospira xianhensis sp. nov.
Thalassospira xianhensis (xian.hen′sis. xianhensis pertaining to Xianhe of Shangdong Province, China, where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are facultatively anaerobic, Gram-negative-staining, curved to spiral rods (0.3–0.6×1.0–1.6 μm).
Colonies on 5 % SSDMY agar are cream–yellow, circular, smooth, opaque and approximately 1.5–2 mm in diameter after incubation at 30 °C for 2 days.
Growth occurs at temperatures between 10 °C and 42 °C (optimum 30 °C), with saline concentrations between 0.1 and 17.0 % (optimum 3.0–6.0 %) and at pH 5.5–9.0 (optimum pH 7.2).
Positive for catalase, oxidase and urease and hydrolysis of Tween 80, but negative for DNase and hydrolysis of starch.
Facultative anaerobic growth with nitrate and nitrite as electron acceptors.

Sensitive to ampicillin, cephalothin, clarithromycin, clindamycin, erythromycin, penicillin and vancomycin, but resistant to ceftriaxone, cefotaxime, ciprofloxacin, gentamicin, streptomycin and tetracycline.

Among the 95 carbon sources in the Biolog system, the following are utilized: adonitol, l-arabinose, d-arabitol, cellobiose, i-erythritol, d-fructose, gentiobiose, α-d-glucose, α-d-lactose, lactulose, d-mannose, raffinose, d-sorbitol, turanose, xylitol, pyruvate methyl ester, d-galactonic acid lactone, d-gluconic acid, d-glucosaminic acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, dl-lactic acid, malonic acid, quinic acid, d- and l-alanine, l-alanyl glycine, l-glutamic acid, glycyl l-aspartic acid, glycyl l-glutamic acid, bromosuccinic acid, l-proline, l-pyroglutamic acid, urocanic acid and glycerol.
Acid is produced from d-fructose, d-glucose, d-galactose, d-xylose, d-mannitol, maltose, mannose and sucrose, but not from lactose or arabinose.
The predominant respiratory quinone is Q-9.
The major fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c, C16 : 0, C16 : 1ω7c, C14 : 0 and C17 : 0 cyclo, with smaller amounts of C16 : 0 3-OH, C18 : 0 and C14 : 0 3-OH.
The genomic DNA G+C content of the type strain is 61.2±1.0 mol%.
The type strain, P-4T (=CGMCC 1.6849T =JCM 14850T) was isolated from a saline soil contaminated by crude oil, collected from Xianhe, Shangdong Province, China.
